etymologies: Middle English maseles, probably from Middle Dutch masel ‘pustule’ (compare with modern Dutch mazelen ‘measles’). The spelling change was due to association with Middle English mesel ‘leprous, leprosy’

definitions: an infectious viral disease causing fever and a red rash on the skin, typically occurring in childhood

examples.text: a severe case of the measles

shortDefinitions: infectious viral disease causing fever and red rash

definitions: a disease of pigs and other animals caused by the encysted larvae of the human tapeworm.
shortDefinitions: disease of pigs and other animals caused by larvae of human tapeworm
